notes.body: Hello Namrata,   We acknowledge receipt of your email.  Kindly note that your phone number has not been blocked by PharmEasy. You may continue to contact us via our official Customer Care number: 08071324888.  We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience or negative experience you may have faced. We do not want any of our customers to have any negative experience. We have responded to your queries multiple times and have made every reasonable effort to address your concerns using all available resources. All matters raised, including those regarding the defective medicine, have been reviewed and addressed to the extent possible. Our actions have included engaging directly with the manufacturer, providing refunds where applicable, and responding to all your communications in a diligent manner.  We have taken all necessary steps within our control to investigate and resolve this matter. At PharmEasy, we take customer concerns seriously and would never want any of our customers to feel neglected or underserved. Please be assured that we continue to act in good faith and are committed to upholding the highest standards of service and customer satisfaction.        Regards,  PharmEasy.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience or negative experience you may have faced. We do not want any of our customers to have any negative experience. We have responded to your queries multiple times and have made every reasonable effort to address your concerns using all available resources. All matters raised, including those regarding the defective medicine, have been reviewed and addressed to the extent possible. Our actions have included engaging directly with the manufacturer, providing refunds where applicable, and responding to all your communications in a diligent manner.

We have taken all necessary steps within our control to investigate and resolve this matter. At PharmEasy, we take customer concerns seriously and would never want any of our customers to feel neglected or underserved. Please be assured that we continue to act in good faith and are committed to upholding the highest standards of service and customer satisfaction.

Regards,
PharmEasy.

helpdesk_ticket.description:
Hi Team,

I need to report a serious issue with today’s sample collection booked via PharmEasy.

  *   The slot was 8:30–9:30 AM. The collector arrived at ~8:45 / 50AM and collected the sample at 9:05 AM—well within the agreed time.
  *   Post-collection, the collector insisted I reschedule to protect his earnings, effectively asking me to falsify the timing. I refused. Looked annoyed but he left.
  *   Shortly after, the call centre repeated the same request and added a third party to the call without informing me—an unacceptable breach of privacy.
  *   The sample has still not been dropped at the centre, raising safety concerns.
  *   When I called the complaint number, I was told this is “recommended process.” If true, this is misleading and needs immediate correction.

Action Requested:

  1.  Assign a different collector for a fresh sample pickup.
  2.  Review and fix this flawed process immediately.

This is a critical compliance and privacy issue. Please treat it with utmost urgency.

Note: Even your audit trail (screenshot below) is falsely updating the time - it's showing now that the sample was collected at 11am but it was done at 9am already. Goes on to show how your team playing with the process and the safety of the samples.

[Image.png]

Regards,

Sameer Borkataky
Head Business Consulting | P&C BPS (India)
9999597727



--

Hi Team,
I need to report a serious issue with today’s sample collection booked via PharmEasy.
  • The slot was 8:30–9:30 AM. The collector arrived at ~8:45 / 50AM and collected the sample at 9:05 AM—well within the agreed time.
  • Post-collection, the collector insisted I reschedule to protect his earnings, effectively asking me to falsify the timing. I refused. Looked annoyed but he left.
  • Shortly after, the call centre repeated the same request and added a third party to the call without informing me—an unacceptable breach of privacy.
  • The sample has still not been dropped at the centre, raising safety concerns.
  • When I called the complaint number, I was told this is “recommended process.” If true, this is misleading and needs immediate correction.
Action Requested:
  1. Assign a different collector for a fresh sample pickup.
  2. Review and fix this flawed process immediately.
This is a critical compliance and privacy issue. Please treat it with utmost urgency. 
Note: Even your audit trail (screenshot below) is falsely updating the time - it's showing now that the sample was collected at 11am but it was done at 9am already. Goes on to show how your team playing with the process and the safety of the samples. 


Regards,

Sameer Borkataky

Hence requesting you to kindly revert us with your convenient time or alternate number to assist you further.     Based on your complaint, please be assured that corrective measures will be taken in line with our company policy to ensure such lapses are avoided in the future.     Further, we wish to inform you that the samples were processed and reports were generated within the prescribed reporting turnaround time, post completion of quality checks. Hence, the reports that have been updated are authentic and reliable.     We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and look forward to providing you with a smooth and hassle-free experience going forward.   For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section.  Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!  Regards, Reshma Kokare PharmEasy

notes.body:
Team,

Was on meetings - did you call from 94849 51700? Airtel is showing it as SPAM call?

None the less - I see you have closed the ticket opened for this grievance. Seems the entire organisation is after closing things withing the TAT without fixing the issue!!!

Is this the organisation wide practice? What corrective measures are taken? I still don't have an update to give a new sample?

I don't think the reports are reliable as the samples were not submitted on time - your system time stamp audit trail was fiddled with just to satisfy the internal process!!!

Please let me know what all being put in place to make sure that these issues are taken care of in the future. Else am willing to take this to required forum.

@dhaval@pharmeasy.in<mailto:dhaval@pharmeasy.in> - I trust your team has taken cognisance to these issues?

Regards,

[cid:image002.png@01DC6F81.27FD7AA0]

Sameer Borkataky
Lead Business Consulting | P&C BPS (India)
DXC Technology
[cid:image001.png@01DC6F7F.F3B57F00]
